question.qText: Which of the following is a logical inference?

aBtn.aText: The purpose of both portraits was to portray the sitter as benevolent.
The purpose of both portraits was to portray the sitters as all-powerful rulers.

question.qText: Which of the following is a logical inference?

aBtn.aText: The portrait tries to show that Marie Antoinette considered herself nothing more than an ordinary mother.
The portrait tries to show that Marie Antoinette was important to France because she was the mother of the future king.

question.qText: Which of the following is a logical inference?

aBtn.aText: The trappings of royalty are on display in both portraits.
Similar symbols of elevated status are present in both portraits.

question.qText: Which of the following is a logical inference?

aBtn.aText: Napoleon needed to connect himself symbolically to French kings and emperors because he had no hereditary claim to the throne.
Marie Antoinette needed to connect herself symbolically to the French throne because she was the daughter of French peasants.
